title: Meghan Markle Kneels Down and Kisses a Young Girl’s Hand in Stunning Photo
text:
It’s been a busy couple of days for Meghan Markle, Prince Harry and baby Archie as they continue their royal tour of Africa. And on day three of the tour, the Duchess of Sussex made a special visit to mothers2mothers—a nonprofit organization in Cape Town fighting for an HIV-free Africa.

During her final engagement in the city, Meghan was greeted by a small group of young people waiting outside the organization’s office. And while there were many photos of the 38-year-old greeting fans, shaking hands and partaking in group hugs, there was one photo that particularly stood out.

The picture featured Markle and an 8-year-old girl named Amara Nenguke. Seeing that the girl was overwhelmed by the encounter, the duchess bent down on one knee and kissed the girl’s hand to console her.

See the sweet photo below.

View photos

Wow.

During her time at mothers2mothers, Markle talked with the “mentor mothers,” played with children and even donated Archie’s old baby clothes and two large bags of “loved but outgrown” clothes from her friends’ children.

So yeah, this is officially our favorite part of the tour so far.
